oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Pattern avoidance in forests of binary shrubs
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Bevan, David
Levin, Derek
Nugent, Peter
Pantone, Jay
Pudwell, Lara
Riehl, Manda
Tlachac, ML
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Mathematics - Combinatorics
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: We investigate pattern avoidance in permutations satisfying some additional restrictions. These are naturally considered in terms of avoiding patterns in linear extensions of certain forest-like partially ordered sets, which we call binary shrub forests. In this context, we enumerate forests avoiding patterns of length three. In four of the five non-equivalent cases, we present explicit enumerations by exhibiting bijections with certain lattice paths bounded above by the line $y=\ell x$, for some $\ell\in\mathbb{Q}^+$, one of these being the celebrated Duchon's club paths with $\ell=2/3$. In the remaining case, we use the machinery of analytic combinatorics to determine the minimal polynomial of its generating function, and deduce its growth rate.
